Detailed Description

template<typename T>
class ebl::ScalarIter_Base< T >

Base class for scalar iterators of Idx. Assumes that Idx doesn't move its data during iteration. Uses simple and fast pointer incrementation if the idx subtends a contiguous region of memory.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Whether this is iterating over contiguous memory.

Copy constructor.

Member Function Documentation

template<typename T>
bool ebl::ScalarIter_Base< T >::notdone (  )  [inline]

Returns true if this iterator hasn't finished iterating. An alternative to using the more standard "iter != end" idiom, as it saves you from having to allocate an end iterator.

template<typename T>
bool ebl::ScalarIter_Base< T >::dataIsSequential ( Idx< T > &  idx  )  [inline, static, protected]

Decrements over contiguous memory.

Returns true if the idx is contiguous in memory, and its elements are laid out in order of increasing memory.

template<typename T>
bool ebl::ScalarIter_Base< T >::operator== ( const ScalarIter_Base< T > &  other  )  const [inline, protected]

Equality operator. Keep protected to prevent comparisons between different subclasses.

Member Data Documentation

template<typename T>
bool ebl::ScalarIter_Base< T >::isSimpleIteration [protected]

Whether or not this iterator simply increments a pointer. If this is false, the inds[] array is not used.
